name: general score - highest quality
description: from official statistical agency or own measurement

name: general score - high quality
description: from external source

name: general score - average quality
description: calculated

name: general score - low quality
description: estimated using proxy

name: general score - lowest quality
description: estimated as residual

name: pedigree score - highest reliability
description: verified(a) data based on measurements(b)
comment: (a) verification may take place in several ways,e.g. by on-site checking, by recalculation,through mass balances or cross-checks with other sources; (b) includes caculated data (e.g.,emissions calculated from inputs to an activity),when the basis for calculation is measurements (e.g. measured inputs). If the calculation is based partly on assumptions, the score would be 2 or 3

name: pedigree score - high reliability
description: verified data partly based on assumptions or non-verified data based on measurements

name: pedigree score - average reliability
description: non-verified data partly based on qualified estimates

name: pedigree score - low reliability
description: qualified estimate (e.g. by industrial expert)

name: pedigree score - lowest reliability
description: non-qualified estimate

name: pedigree score - highest completeness
description: representative data from all sites relevant for the market considered,over an adequate period to even out normal fluctuations

name: pedigree score - high completeness
description: representative data from >50% of the sites relevant for the market considered, over an adequate period to even out normal fluctuations

name: pedigree score - average completeness
description: representative data from only some sites (<<50%) relevant for the market considered or >50% of sites but from shorter periods

name: pedigree score - low completeness
description: representative data from only one site relevant for the market considered or some sites but from shorter periods

name: pedigree score - lowest completeness
description: reresentativeness unknown or data from a small number of sites and from shorter periods

name: pedigree score - highest temporal correlation
description: less than 3 years of difference to the time period of the dataset

name: pedigree score - high temporal correlation
description: less than 6 years of difference to the time period of the dataset

name: pedigree score - average temporal correlation
description: less than 10 years of difference to the time period of the dataset

name: pedigree score - low temporal correlation
description: less than 15 years of difference to the time period of the dataset

name: pedigree score - lowest temporal correlation
description: age of data unknown or more than 15 years of difference to the time period of the dataset

name: pedigree score - highest geographical correlation
description: data from area under study

name: pedigree score - high geographical correlation
description: average data from larger area in which the area under study is included

name: pedigree score - average geographical correlation
description: data from area with similar production conditions

name: pedigree score - low geographical correlation
description: data from area with slightly similar production conditions

name: pedigree score - lowest geographical correlation
description: data from unknown or distinct different area (North America instead of Middle East,OECD-Europe instead of Russia)

name: pedigree score - highest further technological correlation
description: data from enterprises,processes and materials unders study

name: pedigree score - high further technological correlation
description: data from processes and materials under study (i.e. identical technology) but from different enterprises

name: pedigree score - average further technological correlation
description: data from processes and materials under study from different technology

name: pedigree score - low further technological correlation
description: data on related processes or materials

name: pedigree score - lowest further technological correlation
description: data on related processes on laboratory scale or from different technology
